name: ChunkContextSummariser
description: Summarises text for use in chunking for RAG applications - provides a summary of the chunk and a short context situating the chunk in the main document.
systemPrompt: You are a senior software developer, and summarise concepts succinctly for more junior developers to understand.
userPrompt: Here is the document:<document> {document} </document>. Here is the chunk we want to situate within the whole document: <chunk> {chunk} </chunk>. Ignore text that look like to be web page navigation, javascript, or other items that are not the main body of the text. Please give a succinct {wordCount} word context to situate this chunk within the overall document for the purposes of improving search retrieval of the chunk. Answer only with the succinct context and nothing else.

userPromptParameters.chunk: The chunk to be situated within the document.
userPromptParameters.wordCount: The number of words to use for the summary.

name: RequirementsGuidelineChecker
description: Reviews a requirement for conformance to good practice.
systemPrompt: You are a senior business analyst. You review the work of more junior staff members and privide clear feedback in simple language.
userPrompt: Here is a requirement:<requirement> {requirement} </requirement>. Review the requirement in the light of the following guidelines:<guidelines> {guidelines} </guidelines>. Please give a succinct {wordCount} word review of the requirement by applying the guidelines. Focus on the most important issues first. For each issue found, cite the specific guideline rule number that was violated. Provide a re-phrased requirement (or multiple requirements if necessary) to comply with the guidelines, using code fences to demarcate the suggested new requirement(s). Consider carefully if you need to split the requirement into multiple suggested new requirements.

userPromptsParameters.name: wordCount
userPromptsParameters.description: The number of words to use for the review.

name: RequirementsSplitter
description: Reviews a requirement and splits it if necessary.
systemPrompt: You are a senior business analyst. You review the work of more junior staff members and privide clear feedback in simple language.
userPrompt: Here is a requirement:<requirement> {requirement} </requirement>. If the requirement should be split into multiple requirements, please do so using code fences to demarcate the suggested new requirements. Otherwise, return the original requirement between code fences.
